senses.ex: We always keep extra supplies on hand in case of emergency.

Tips.title: Emergency Preparation
Tips.description: Use 'on hand' to show preparedness for unexpected situations.
Tips.example: Keep a flashlight on hand during a storm.

Tips.title: Resource Availability
Tips.description: Stress the immediate availability of something, typically resources or supplies.
Tips.example: I have some spare batteries on hand.

senses.de: Present and ready to help or act
senses.ex: A team of experts were on hand to answer questions

Tips.title: Immediate Assistance
Tips.description: Indicates that help or support is immediately available.
Tips.example: Our technician is on hand to deal with any issues.

Tips.title: Readiness to Act
Tips.description: Conveys someone's readiness to take action if necessary.
Tips.example: The lifeguard is always on hand to ensure safety.

senses.ex: The nurse was on hand when my son was born

Tips.title: Close Proximity
Tips.description: Emphasizes that someone or something is within easy reach.
Tips.example: Don't worry, the fire extinguisher is on hand.

Tips.title: Quick Response
Tips.description: Suggests being nearby to quickly respond to needs or events.
Tips.example: Police were on hand as the parade began.

senses.ex: Have the tools on hand in case we need to fix anything.

Tips.title: Preparedness
Tips.description: Highlights being prepared in advance, not just being available.
Tips.example: Have your notes on hand for the meeting.

Tips.title: Efficient Planning
Tips.description: Shows that one has planned for quick access or use.
Tips.example: Make sure to have the contract on hand when they arrive.
